item.description:
TranScriptions presents:
An Open Mic Night at The Crossing
to benefit the Massachusetts Transgender Political Coalition

Thursday, November 19th, 8pm
27 Temple Place, Boston, MA
Sliding Scale Admission: $5 - $10
~~Vegan Bake Sale to benefit Transcriptions~~
All Performers Welcome! Read Some Poetry! Sing Some Songs!

Featured Performance By:
Miss Leslie-Anne Rios

LezleeAnne, a.k.a. Leslie-Anne Rios, previously known as Les Rios
(first 3 CDs), is a survivor, transexual, controversial entity,
natural entertainer and a serious musician who has overcome many
obstacles and continues to shine brighter as her star rises. Her
deeper story includes gender-identity crisis, poverty and running away
to join the carnival at age 16. After 900 shows in 150 cities,
covering 1/4-million miles in 2 countries, LezleeAnne left the road to
record, produce & release her latest CD, "Queen of the World".

**There will be filming at this event as part of The Crossing documentary**
(Inclusion is optional; only those who wish to be filmed will be filmed.)

group.who: Friends of the Boston Dyke March
group.name: The Boston Dyke March

item.name: TranScriptions Presents: An Open Mic Night at The Crossing to benefit the MTPC
